Articles.Content:
As in title, how big it is for VERY deep space contracts? Because I'm about to get to maneuver, and I have like one try before the deadline. So how close my orbit has to be to fit the requirements?


Edited September 30, 2016 by The Aziz
It's fairly forgiving, but f5 well before your burn

6 minutes ago, Gojira1000 said:

It's fairly forgiving, but f5 well before your burn

That's out of the question, I have two burns separated by few years, so if I do first, and after second it turns out that I failed the first one, then, well..

I had a very deep space one, and it was more forgiving than I expected.  Actually a bit of a disappointment, since I tried so hard to get it visibly perfect when planning the maneuvres, and the contract completed long before it really matched. 

However, I'd be surprised if your orbit as pictured works. You should be able to get a lot closer with an anti-normal burn right now, without spending too much fuel and without it taking any noticably longer time to get to the final orbit-matching node.

In fact, if you accept a slight loss due to overshooting Ap, adding a touch of prograde to the anti-normal burn now will get you to an intersect much faster, for a very reasonable cost.
